Package space.sunqian.fs.invoke

Interface Invocable

public interface Invocable
This interface represents an invocable entity, such as a method, constructor, function, executable task, executable scope or other similar entity.

This interface provides two equivalent methods: invoke(Object, Object...) which declares an unchecked exception, and invokeChecked(Object, Object...) which declares a checked exception.

The thread-safety of this interface depends on invocable entity it holds.

    • invoke

      default Object invoke(@Nullable @Nullable Object inst, Object @Nonnull ... args) throws InvocationException
      Executes this invocable entity with an instance and the invocation arguments. The instance typically represents the owner object of a method or the scope of 'this', and the arguments typically represent the actual arguments passed to the method or function. The instance can be null if this entity is a static method, constructor, or other similar entity.

      This method only throws InvocationException which wraps any other Throwable, the original cause can be retrieved by Throwable.getCause(). This method is equivalent to: 

      
 try {
     return invokeChecked(inst, args);
 } catch (Throwable e) {
     throw new InvocationException(e);
 }
      Parameters:
      inst - the instance
      args - the invocation arguments
      Returns:
      the invocation result
      Throws:
      InvocationException - for any Throwable

    • invokeChecked

      Object invokeChecked(@Nullable @Nullable Object inst, Object @Nonnull ... args) throws Throwable
      Executes this invocable entity with an instance and the invocation arguments. The instance typically represents the owner object of a method or the scope of 'this', and the arguments typically represent the actual arguments passed to the method or function. The instance can be null if this entity is a static method, constructor, or other similar entity.

      This method directly throws any exception thrown from the underlying invocation.

      Parameters:
      inst - the instance
      args - the invocation arguments
      Returns:
      the invocation result
      Throws:
      Throwable - directly throws any exception thrown from the underlying invocation
